definition: to get oneself a wife/to take a daughter-in-law
to take a wife/to marry (a woman)
daughter-in-law
woman

sentences.english: He dreams of the teaching job at Kabul University and of marrying a woman back home. She is the daughter of family friends a Sayed Shiite who traces her lineage to the prophet Muhammad.
sentences.chinese: 他夢想着在喀布爾大學任教，然後回老家娶媳婦。

sentences.english: Since then no one dared to mention about "the bride of river god"any more.
sentences.chinese: 打那兒以後，誰也不敢再提給河伯娶媳婦的事了。

sentences.english: Since then, the Handan area, it left a groom to marry the daughter-in-law to discredit custom face.
sentences.chinese: 自此，邯鄲一帶，便留下了新郎娶媳婦抹黑臉的風俗。

sentences.english: On the third day there was a wedding at Cana-in-Galilee.
sentences.chinese: 第三天，加利利的迦拿有一家人娶媳婦，設宴慶賀。

sentences.english: She said that her brother was marrying next October.
sentences.chinese: 她說她弟弟10月份娶媳婦。

definition: to take a wife
cheerful and optimistic/in a good mood/gaily
wedding night
to give change
to propose marriage
marriage/CL:門|门[men2]
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to look anxious (idiom)/to look miserable
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
(of parents) to bring up children for the purpose of being looked after in old age
to be furious/to fly into a terrible rage
to send (sb) away/to change the subject/to open (an umbrella etc)
to deceive/to cheat
to push oneself forward/to seek fame/to be in the limelight/same as 出鋒頭|出锋头[chu1 feng1 tou5]
